item.title: 俄罗斯和欧洲官员认为美国对俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司的关系感兴趣
item.description: 俄罗斯和欧洲官员称，美国正在探索与能源巨头俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）在全球项目上的合作方式，这是在努力促成乌克兰和平协议的同时与克里姆林宫建立更紧密关系的一步。【原文：Russian and European officials say the US is exploring ways to work with energy giant Gazprom PJSC on global projects, a step toward forging closer ties with the Kremlin while trying to broker a peace deal on Ukraine.】

item.title: 如何定义 "播客 "之争愈演愈烈
item.description:
随着 YouTube 和 Spotify 在播客和视频领域的不断深入，曾经泾渭分明的业务界限正变得越来越模糊

。【原文：

As YouTube pushes deeper into podcasting and Spotify pursues video, once-distinct business lines are getting increasingly blurry

item.title: 华盛顿特区房地产市场发出疲软信号，库存增加
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统和埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）不断努力削减联邦劳动力之际，华盛顿地区的待售住房库存连续第三周上升。【原文：For-sale housing inventory in the Washington area rose for a third straight week amid ongoing efforts by President Donald Trump and Elon Musk to trim the federal workforce.】

item.title: 姆努钦否认美国经济衰退，称股市回调 "合情合理
item.description: 前财政部长史蒂文-姆努钦（Steven Mnuchin）对美国经济衰退的风险打了折扣，并淡化了当前股市的下跌，认为这是市场对唐纳德-特朗普总统咄咄逼人的贸易策略的调整。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin discounted risks of a US recession, and played down the current selloff in equities as an adjustment, in a market that had been highly valued, to President Donald Trump’s aggressive trade tactics.】

item.title: 卡塔尔向叙利亚供应天然气，这是后阿萨德时代的最新举措
item.description: 卡塔尔开始通过约旦向叙利亚供应天然气，这是前总统巴沙尔-阿萨德下台后对这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家临时政府的最新支持。【原文：Qatar began supplying natural gas to Syria through Jordan, the latest boost to the war-torn country’s interim government following the fall of former president Bashar al-Assad.】

item.title: 阿克曼的潘兴公司寻求 15 亿美元出售环球公司股份
item.description: 亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）旗下对冲基金潘兴广场（Pershing Square）的一群股东提出出售环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group NV）约 2.7% 的流通股。【原文：A group of shareholders affiliated with billionaire Bill Ackman’s hedge fund Pershing Square are offering to sell about 2.7% of the outstanding shares in Universal Music Group NV.】

item.title: 反击还是蛰伏？应对美国关税的两难选择
item.description: 美国的主要贸易伙伴对唐纳德-特朗普总统周三生效的25%钢铝进口关税做出了一系列回应。大多数国家选择不立即采取报复行动，许多国家表示愿意进行谈判。其他国家则采取了更具对抗性的做法。【原文：Major US trading partners have offered a range of responses to President Donald Trump’s 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, which took effect Wednesday. Most opted against immediate retaliation and many sounded ready to talk instead. Others took a more confrontational approach.】

item.title: 共和党人加紧攻击欧洲的新 ESG 法规
item.description: 美国田纳西州参议员比尔-哈格蒂（Bill Hagerty）提出了一项法案，他说该法案旨在保护美国公司免受欧洲环境、社会和公司治理法规的影响。【原文：US Senator Bill Hagerty of Tennessee has introduced a bill that he says is designed to protect American companies from ESG regulations in Europe.】

item.title: 加拿大顶级杂货商称美国产品销量 "迅速 "下降
item.description: 加拿大第二大超市公司表示，抵制美国商品的行动正在迅速展开，这是对唐纳德-特朗普总统征收关税和威胁使用 "经济力量 "使加拿大成为美国第51个州的回应。【原文：Canada’s second-biggest supermarket company said a boycott of US goods is quickly taking hold in reaction to President Donald Trump’s tariffs and his threats of “economic force” to make the country the 51st US state.】

item.title: 阿联酋官员就购买更多英伟达人工智能芯片向美国施压
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿联酋一位高级官员计划访问华盛顿，要求更容易获得美国技术，并讨论在美国投资的问题，试图在人工智能所需的先进半导体出口管制问题上左右特朗普政府。【原文：A top UAE official plans to visit Washington to press for easier access to American technology and discuss investment in the US, according to people familiar with the matter, seeking to sway the Trump administration on export controls governing the advanced semiconductors needed to power artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 巴拿马批准首家量子公司从矿山装运库存铜矿
item.description: 第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）获准开始发运巴拿马的库存铜矿，这是当局可能愿意就重启停滞不前的铜矿进行谈判的最新迹象。【原文：First Quantum Minerals Ltd. was cleared to begin shipping out stockpiled copper in Panama, the latest sign authorities may be willing to negotiate a restart of the stalled mine.】

item.title: 华尔街忧心忡忡，散户却不断买入美股
item.description: 尽管唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战让美国股市急速走向调整，但那些乘着牛市创下历史新高的个人投资者还没有放弃他们的信念。【原文：Even as Donald Trump’s trade war sends the US stock market hurtling toward a correction, the individual investors who rode the bull run to record highs haven’t yet given up their faith.】

item.title: MLB 雷霆队放弃圣彼得堡新球馆交易
item.description: 坦帕湾鳐鱼队周四宣布，将退出在佛罗里达州圣彼得堡市新建一座价值 13.7 亿美元体育场的交易。【原文：The Tampa Bay Rays are backing out of a deal that would have built a new $1.37 billion stadium in St. Petersburg, Florida, the team announced on Thursday.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉在特朗普领导下的政策转变对该国债券造成冲击
item.description: 美国和委内瑞拉之间的一系列政策翻转给该国债券市场带来了新一轮波动，迫使投资者重新调整对 600 亿美元债务重组前景的押注。【原文：A series of policy flip-flops between the US and Venezuela is hitting the nation’s bond market with a fresh bout of volatility, forcing investors to recalibrate bets on the outlook for a $60 billion debt restructuring.】

item.title: 禽流感袭来，欧盟鸡蛋价格飙升至十多年来最高点
item.description: 由于禽流感疫情继续肆虐全球鸡蛋业，欧盟鸡蛋批发价格已攀升至十多年来的最高水平。【原文：European Union wholesale egg prices have climbed to the highest level in more than a decade as bird flu outbreaks continue to roil the industry across the world.】

item.title: 英国宇航公司（BAE）称，美国航天发射能力不足，欧洲必须提高航天发射能力
item.description: 该地区最大的国防承包商的一位经理说，随着 SpaceX 公司提供的发射位置满员，欧洲必须扩大自己的太空发射服务，以便为该行业创造更多的能力。【原文：Europe must expand its own space launch services in order to create more capacity in the industry as slots provided by SpaceX fill up, a manager at the region’s largest defense contractor said.】

item.title: 英美资源集团计划裁员作为重组的一部分
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）计划通过出售资产和分拆铂金业务来进行业务重组，并计划在公司总部裁员。【原文：Anglo American Plc is planning more job cuts at its corporate office, as it restructures its business by selling assets and spinning off its platinum unit.】

item.title: 贝森特说美元近期的下跌是一种自然 "调整
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）淡化了美元近期的跌势，称这是一种自然的 "调整"，因为交易商对一系列新的经济信号和政策采取了观望态度。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent played down the recent decline in the US dollar, saying it was a natural “adjustment” as traders adopt a wait-and-see attitude toward a barrage of new economic signals and policies.】

item.title: 阿尔法明撤离刚果矿区后锡矿大涨，叛军大举进攻
item.description: 在阿尔法明资源公司（Alphamin Resources Corp.）表示，由于叛乱武装组织的推进，该公司正在撤离刚果民主共和国的一个矿场之后，锡矿反弹了近 5%。【原文：Tin rallied almost 5% after Alphamin Resources Corp. said it’s evacuating a mine in the Democratic Republic of the Congo due to the advance of insurgent militant groups.】

item.title: 世界银行称石油资源丰富的南苏丹经济将萎缩 30
item.description: 据世界银行称，南苏丹的经济在截至 6 月的财政年度将萎缩约 30%，但在恢复石油出口后可能会反弹。【原文：South Sudan’s economy will contract by about 30% in the fiscal year ending June, but could rebound after the resumption of oil exports, according to the World Bank.】

item.title: Cerba 医疗保健公司债券下跌，因为所有者 EQT 正在权衡债务方案
item.description: 由于私募股权所有者 EQT AB 正在审查这家法国实验室公司的债务方案，Cerba Healthcare SAS 的债券本周暴跌。【原文：Bonds of Cerba Healthcare SAS tumbled this week as private equity owner EQT AB reviews options for the French laboratory firm’s debt stack.】

item.title: 德意志银行认为商业地产面临更多不利因素
item.description: 德意志银行预计，商业地产市场将继续面临不利因素，其中美国的弱点尤为明显，那里的租赁活动放缓，空置率高于欧洲。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG expects headwinds to continue in commercial real estate markets, with weaknesses especially pronounced in the US where leasing activity is slower and vacancy rates are higher than in Europe.】

item.title: 美国制裁伊朗石油部长和影子舰队
item.description: 特朗普政府正在对伊朗石油部长实施制裁，并针对更多与德黑兰用来规避制裁的 "影子船队 "有关的公司和船只。【原文：The Trump administration is imposing sanctions on Iran’s oil minister, as well as targeting more companies and vessels linked to the “shadow fleet” that Tehran uses to circumvent sanctions.】

item.title: 关税风险加剧，美国股市徘徊于调整区域附近
item.description: 由于对贸易战经济影响的担忧抵消了对美国 2 月份批发通胀停滞数据的乐观情绪，周三美股的反弹被证明是暂时的。【原文：A bounce in US stocks on Wednesday proved temporary, as anxiety about the economic impact of a trade war offset optimism over data showing US wholesale inflation stagnated in February.】
